ratings.comment: Vlad is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He's laid back and fun in class that makes participating much less intimidating and still feels like you're learning. Homework and exams always felt like just enough to help you learn, never felt annoying or too much to handle. Also 10/10 fashion taste

Professor Dima was super cool. He would assign readings and lectures to be completed in the first half of the week on your own time and then we would meet for a discussion for the second half of the week. Prepare by taking notes and then just listen and participate in group works for points. Straightforward and easy!

He was a great professor, made for an easy A class. The grade was made up of a midterm paper, final paper, and weekly discussion posts (1-2 sentences). The readings weren't challenging just try and stay on top of them.

Professor Dima is a one of a kind professor. His discussions are very engaging. Dima has a wonderful teaching style and is very kind. Coming to class felt like more like a respite from the day to day stress of college rather than an obligation. I highly suggest taking a course with Dima if you can!

Vlad is by far the best French teacher I've ever had. His lectures are engaging and hilarious, he's also incredibly passionate about discussing the topics of the class and makes the whole class interested. The class content (French 228) is something you don't want to miss! Wish I could take this class again.

African 100 is a super easy course. Almost every week there are guest lecturers and then you have a quiz on the lectures in discussion and as long as you go to lecture you'll get the points. Besides quizzes the only other grades are the midterm and final which are take home and only have short answers and a two page essay each.

French440/African100- He's open to different interpretations in analysis papers & really just cares that YOU feel like you've gained some new perspective from his class. Participation is important in small classes but he's very accessible/reassuring in office hours & appreciates any demonstration of effort. A very casual & funny lecturer!
Really good teacher! He's nice, fair, and funny. Participation heavy, but easy if you raise your hand a couple times each class. Really recommend this professor for French!

To be honest, Vlad is that dude! I've had excellent French teachers in the past, but Vlad might just be the best one yet. He is caring, passionate, funny, and strives for all his students to be successful. Ultimately, the workload is minimal and his tests are very straightforward. Pay attention, participate, and do readings, and you'll do well.

Professor Dima is very fun and enthusiastic about French. The class isn't tough as long as you show up to class and participate or at least pay attention. He is a very fair grader and absolutely wants you to do well in his class. Would definitely recommend!

His quirky personality shone through in his teaching and his interactions with the students, which could make sometimes dull subjets be more interesting. He could be kind of picky about some things while grading ( like word chose with synonyms) overall he was pretty fair. Make sure to do all of the homework, even if he says it won't be collected.

Great teacher. Engaging and very personable. He is clearly passionate about French language and culture which made the class more fun. Only downside is that he didn't put any grades in the gradebook all semester, so you don't really know what grade you have in the class until you receive your final grade.
Vlad is a probably the most fashionable teacher in Van Hise. Class is fun and engaging (I never wanted to skip) and it's very doable to get an AB. Just make sure you read and do the hw.
